results.title: Well laid plans (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
Central to all management action is planning and decision making. Both involve information collecting and making choices. In some situations it is best to involve others in the process. Planning and decision making in situations of high certainty are considered in the context of present day management culture.

results.title: Welfare of the workers
results.creator_credit: GPO Film Unit, Great Britain. Ministry of Information and Humphrey Jennings
results.brief_description: Shows efforts by the British government to maintain production during the war. Many working men and women were required to relocate to factories away from their home town to support the changing production demands of war. Recognising that the health, safety and welfare of workers was critical to victory, various programs were implemented to assist relocated workers. These varied from locating suitable accommodation, providing health services and ensuring that recreational activities were available to workers during their leisure time. New lighting and ventilation designs were also introduced into factories to compensate for the conditions caused by the blackouts that were enforced during aerial attacks.

results.title: Welcoming valley: the mighty Murray
results.brief_description: Victorian Government promotional film extolling the virtues of the Murray River Valley as a tourist destination. Includes footage of Yarrawonga/Mulwala, Echuca, Cohuna, Kerang, Swan Hill and Mildura.

results.title: Welcome to Television (1956)
results.brief_description: Gyngell is often credited as being the first person to appear on Australian television on 16 September 1956, when he spoke the words, ‘Good evening, and welcome to television’.

constellations_other.name: Lost and found
constellations_other.description: Blossoming from Alice Guy Blaché’s The Cabbage-Patch Fairy, this Constellation explores the impermanence and enduring nature of the moving image.

results.title: Welcome back, Norman
results.creator_credit: Sharon Burke, Film Communications, Mt Lemmon Production and Shevard Goldstein
results.brief_description: The comical character, Norman Krasner, is presented once again in this sequel of “Norman Krasner”. As a character who can turn common misfortune into near disaster, Norman depicts the weary businessman returning from a business trip. The setting is a busy airport’s parking lot. Norman turns the simple experience of getting out of the parking lot into a hilarious example of “Murphy’s Law”. Cast: Doug MacIntosh.

results.title: Weight training for sport
results.creator_credit: Town and Country Productions and Bill Latto
results.brief_description: The National Coach to the British Amateur Weight-lifting Authority, Mr Al Murray, instructs pupils at a London gymnasium in weight training techniques. Demonstrates how the correct exercises can increase athletic proficiency in all fields of sporting endeavour.
